title: One Day To Stop This WORLD
body_text:
Charity Fund: ALZHEIMER'S ASSOCIATION
Want to take that extra step? Here's your golden chance and what a tremendous cause, too. Headed by proud Sunrise Senior Living employee John Tronolone, he and his occupational team members are kindly asking for just an ounce of financial support in their "Walk To End Alzheimer's" charity fund. All proceeds will benefit the Alzheimer's Association and each donator of a $1 minimum will receive a complimentary mini
ClifBar
as a "thank you." This is truly a worth-while effort and your contribution would certainly be appreciated.
For more information, check the local Sunrise page by clicking
HERE
.
The Main Event: KATZ v. WOLF
Now, if you're looking for blood, than make no mistake about it - this malignant confrontation is for
you
. The evil, behind-the-scenes mastermind has chosen the game's baddest animals and forced them to duke it out. But only one will survive. Catch this match-of-the-year contender when "The Big Kat"
Zach Katz
clashes with "The Wolf Man"
Justin Wolf
in this do-or-die encounter. And remember, it's Wolf's birthday!
One Musn't Forget: The HISTORY
The
ECD
World has reached it's next milestone and no doubt it'll be a classic. If you're not convinced or remain unsure of your attendance, why not take a stroll down memory lane ...
FAMILY AFFAIR I
It was arguably the most important and memorable outing in the history of
ECD
. Personalized invitations and countless emails and texts helped set the stage, and trust that the stakes were sky high. Come game time, the dodgeball battlefield was swarmed with close friends and beloved relatives in what would soon become a successful annual tradition. A whopping 25-plus spectactors captured the sights and sounds of the multi-hour extravaganza, with reviews universally acclaimed throughout the community.
→ May 31, 2008
→ Event #140; FAMILY AFFAIR was actually the subtitle for the chronological DODGEBALL CXL
→ Active Participants: 39
FAMILY REUNION
In the midst of the
Adams Era
of
ECD
, the second annual FAMILY AFFAIR reunited the stars of yesteryear for this one-time-only presentation. Again, the audience was jam-packed and those feeling frisky risked their physical health for an ounce of dodgeball goodness. It was really a sight to see.
→ May 23, 2009
→ Event #172
→ Active Participants: 30-40*
→ *To date, this is the
only
ECD
event under Tronolone without any recorded statistics other than the main event match-up
FAMILY AFFAIR III
The third installment was crucial for one main reason: the rebirth of
ECD
. All eyes and ears were glued to the promotional posters, adrenaline-pumping previews, and major announcements for the agonizing month before showtime. By nightfall on the 24th of July, 2010, the unforgettable nostalgic feeling re-emerged for countless diehards who had remained in hope for this incredible evening.
→ July 24, 2010
→ Event #173
→ Active Participants: 33
FAMILY AFFAIR IV
And of course the yearly spectacle just had to continue in 2011, generating yet another all-around fun-filled gathering for players and crowd members alike. Starring the likes of Kenny Jacobs, Bobby Vetrano, and newly-inducted
ECDElite
Hall of Famers Lauren Stopa and John Tronolone, not a single soul left Wall High School unhappy.
→ June 18, 2011
→ Event #182
→ Active Participants: 24
FAMILY AFFAIR V
Saturday, June 23, 2012
5:30pm - 9:30pm
Wall High School
body_html:
Charity Fund: ALZHEIMER'S ASSOCIATION
Want to take that extra step? Here's your golden chance and what a tremendous cause, too. Headed by proud Sunrise Senior Living employee John Tronolone, he and his occupational team members are kindly asking for just an ounce of financial support in their "Walk To End Alzheimer's" charity fund. All proceeds will benefit the Alzheimer's Association and each donator of a $1 minimum will receive a complimentary mini ClifBar as a "thank you." This is truly a worth-while effort and your contribution would certainly be appreciated.
For more information, check the local Sunrise page by clicking HERE.

The Main Event: KATZ v. WOLF
Now, if you're looking for blood, than make no mistake about it - this malignant confrontation is for you. The evil, behind-the-scenes mastermind has chosen the game's baddest animals and forced them to duke it out. But only one will survive. Catch this match-of-the-year contender when "The Big Kat" Zach Katz clashes with "The Wolf Man" Justin Wolf in this do-or-die encounter. And remember, it's Wolf's birthday!

One Musn't Forget: The HISTORY
The ECD World has reached it's next milestone and no doubt it'll be a classic. If you're not convinced or remain unsure of your attendance, why not take a stroll down memory lane ...

FAMILY AFFAIR I
It was arguably the most important and memorable outing in the history of ECD. Personalized invitations and countless emails and texts helped set the stage, and trust that the stakes were sky high. Come game time, the dodgeball battlefield was swarmed with close friends and beloved relatives in what would soon become a successful annual tradition. A whopping 25-plus spectactors captured the sights and sounds of the multi-hour extravaganza, with reviews universally acclaimed throughout the community.
→ May 31, 2008
→ Event #140; FAMILY AFFAIR was actually the subtitle for the chronological DODGEBALL CXL
→ Active Participants: 39

FAMILY REUNION
In the midst of the Adams Era of ECD, the second annual FAMILY AFFAIR reunited the stars of yesteryear for this one-time-only presentation. Again, the audience was jam-packed and those feeling frisky risked their physical health for an ounce of dodgeball goodness. It was really a sight to see.
→ May 23, 2009
→ Event #172
→ Active Participants: 30-40*
→ *To date, this is the only ECD event under Tronolone without any recorded statistics other than the main event match-up

FAMILY AFFAIR III
The third installment was crucial for one main reason: the rebirth of ECD. All eyes and ears were glued to the promotional posters, adrenaline-pumping previews, and major announcements for the agonizing month before showtime. By nightfall on the 24th of July, 2010, the unforgettable nostalgic feeling re-emerged for countless diehards who had remained in hope for this incredible evening.
→ July 24, 2010
→ Event #173
→ Active Participants: 33

FAMILY AFFAIR IV
And of course the yearly spectacle just had to continue in 2011, generating yet another all-around fun-filled gathering for players and crowd members alike. Starring the likes of Kenny Jacobs, Bobby Vetrano, and newly-inducted ECDElite Hall of Famers Lauren Stopa and John Tronolone, not a single soul left Wall High School unhappy.
→ June 18, 2011
→ Event #182
→ Active Participants: 24

FAMILY AFFAIR V
Saturday, June 23, 2012
5:30pm - 9:30pm
Wall High School
